job.title: Assoc Engineer, Software (RPA Developer)
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Computer Software,Financial Services
job.description:
Job Description
Designs and develops internal Robotic Process Automation (RPA) bots for the automation of business processes and transactions.
Robotic Process Automation is the automation of repetitive, time/resource-intensive digital processes using software to replace the need for human involvement.
Using an RPA development platform, a developer configures a metaphorical software “robot” to capture and interpret applications for processing a transaction, manipulating data, triggering responses and communicating with other systems
This position is an entry level developer position working under the direction of a Developer, Sr Developer, and/or Architect, with project complexity limited and commensurate with experience level.
Functional Group
Product and Technology
Location
TX208-TX-Frisco Bridges Building A (Duke Br I)
Location Address
7668 Warren Pkwy
City
Frisco
State
Texas
Zip
75034
Travel Required?
No
Responsibilities
Translate business, and functional Robotic Process Automation requirements into documented technical specifications.
Utilize development skills and development platforms to build (code) and test new RPA functionality per technical specifications, with deliverables to include code builds and documented test results.
Partner with the requesting Business Unit on refining the RPA approach and delivery, including dependency identification and timing/delivery estimates
Participate in code reviews (walkthroughs) of technical specifications and RPA code with other members of the technical team, communicating design, requirements, functionality and limitations of systems/applications to team and development lead.
Utilize departmental Systems Development Lifecycle Methodology as a guide for development activities.
Contribute to and work to meet project schedules by providing accurate estimates of effort required for development deliverables, by providing updates on project progress to development and project management, and by escalating issues that might affect project success to management.
Maintain technical skills and expertise through continuing education and training.
Also responsible for other Duties/Projects as assigned by business management as needed.
Qualifications
2 years developing Robotic Process Automation solutions
2 years working with a wireless carrier
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Ability to identify RPA opportunities and lead/co-lead development
RPA Development Platform experience
Desktop/Mobile Application Development
Software Development
Expertise with Microsoft Office and similar business software
Familiar with Software Development Lifecycle and project methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, etc.)
Ability to work with non-technical and technical individuals
Company Profile
T-Mobile U.S. Inc. (NASDAQ: TMUS) is America’s supercharged Un-carrier, delivering an advanced 4G LTE and transformative nationwide 5G network that will offer reliable connectivity for all. T-Mobile’s customers benefit from its unmatched combination of value and quality, unwavering obsession with offering them the best possible service experience and undisputable drive for disruption that creates competition and innovation in wireless and beyond. Based in Bellevue, Wash., T-Mobile provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile, Metro by T-Mobile and Sprint. For more information please visit: http://www.t-mobile.com
